verses.roman:
bauddhācārya 'nava praśna' saba uṭhāila
dṛḍha yukti-tarke prabhu khaṇḍa khaṇḍa kaila

synonyms: bauddha-ācārya—the teacher of the Buddhist cult; nava praśna—nine different types of questions; saba—all; uṭhāila—raised; dṛḍha—strong; yukti—argument; tarke—with logic; prabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; khaṇḍa khaṇḍa kaila—broke into pieces.
translation: The teacher of the Buddhist cult set forth the nine principles, but Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu broke them to pieces with His strong logic.
